clusters.name: Knowledge Socialization
clusters.narrative: Tacit knowledge is shared through shared experiences and social interaction. New members enter the community through legitimate peripheral participation, observing and learning from experienced practitioners. This process creates a foundation of shared understanding through direct observation, imitation, and practice. The quality of social interaction and shared context determines how effectively tacit knowledge transfers between community members.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how observation and imitation facilitate knowledge transfer in social contexts

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Shared tacit understanding provides raw material for articulation and formalization
Successful socialization enables movement toward community core participation

clusters.name: Knowledge Externalization
clusters.narrative: Tacit knowledge gained through socialization is articulated into explicit concepts and models. Community members engage in dialogue and reflection to convert their intuitive understanding into communicable forms. This process involves creating metaphors, analogies, and conceptual frameworks that make implicit knowledge accessible to others. The difficulty of articulation and the quality of dialogue influence how effectively knowledge becomes explicit.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain the cognitive and communicative processes of converting tacit to explicit knowledge

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives tacit knowledge foundation from socialization processes
Articulated explicit knowledge flows into systematic combination processes
Core members facilitate externalization while externalization reinforces core expertise

clusters.name: Knowledge Combination
clusters.narrative: Explicit knowledge from various sources is systematically combined, organized, and integrated into coherent knowledge systems. This process involves categorizing, editing, and synthesizing different pieces of explicit knowledge to create more complex and applicable knowledge structures. Documentation, databases, and formal procedures emerge as knowledge becomes more structured and accessible across the community.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how knowledge is organized, categorized, and integrated into systematic structures

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives articulated explicit knowledge for systematic organization
Organized knowledge systems flow into learning and application processes
Structured knowledge contributes to community tools and resources

clusters.name: Knowledge Internalization
clusters.narrative: Explicit knowledge is learned, applied, and absorbed back into tacit understanding through practice and experience. Community members engage with organized knowledge through learning-by-doing, experimentation, and practical application. As knowledge becomes internalized, it transforms into personal expertise and intuitive capability. This process creates new tacit knowledge that can restart the socialization cycle.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how knowledge transforms through practical application and reflection

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives organized knowledge systems for learning and application
Newly internalized tacit knowledge feeds back into socialization processes
Internalized expertise enables progression toward core community membership

clusters.name: Community Core Development
clusters.narrative: Community members progress from peripheral participation to core engagement through demonstrated expertise and contribution. As individuals internalize knowledge and develop capabilities, they take on more central roles in the community. Core members guide newcomers, facilitate knowledge processes, and steward community practices. This progression creates a dynamic where expertise distribution affects all knowledge processes.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain the progression from novice to expert and the development of mastery

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives socialized members ready for progression
Receives members with internalized expertise for core development
Core members facilitate externalization while progression reinforces core
Core development strengthens infrastructure while infrastructure supports development

clusters.name: Community Infrastructure
clusters.narrative: Supporting structures, tools, and resources that enable and sustain knowledge processes evolve through community activity. As knowledge becomes combined and internalized, the community develops shared artifacts, communication channels, and collaborative spaces. This infrastructure both enables knowledge flow and is shaped by it, creating a reinforcing cycle where better infrastructure improves knowledge processes, which in turn enhances infrastructure.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain how social structures both enable and are shaped by community practices

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives structured knowledge that becomes embedded in infrastructure
Infrastructure supports core development while core members shape infrastructure
Infrastructure enables socialization while social practices shape infrastructure evolution

clustering_strategy.overall_narrative: The knowledge creation system begins with Knowledge Socialization where tacit knowledge transfers through shared experiences and peripheral participation [Process 1]. This shared understanding flows into Knowledge Externalization [overlap: Process 1→2] where community members articulate tacit knowledge into explicit concepts through dialogue. The articulated knowledge then moves to Knowledge Combination [overlap: Process 2→3] where explicit knowledge is systematically organized into coherent systems. These organized knowledge systems feed into Knowledge Internalization [overlap: Process 3→4] where learning-by-doing transforms explicit knowledge back into personal tacit expertise. The newly internalized knowledge creates a feedback loop [connection: Process 4→1] that enriches future socialization processes. Throughout this SECI spiral, Community Core Development [Process 5] enables member progression from periphery to core, with core members facilitating knowledge processes while their own expertise grows through internalization [feedback: Process 4→5]. Community Infrastructure [Process 6] provides the supporting structures that enable all knowledge processes, evolving through the combination of explicit knowledge [connection: Process 3→6] and being shaped by core member stewardship [feedback: Process 5→6]. This creates a dynamic knowledge ecosystem where social learning, knowledge transformation, community development, and infrastructure evolution continuously reinforce each other in a virtuous cycle of organizational learning.
